info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 8:22PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: .Scattered thunderstorms with heavy rain will cross the Lynchburg area this evening. Most of this rainfall will runoff due to saturated soils and produce minor flooding. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Virginia and south central Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, in central Virginia, Amherst, Appomattox, Campbell and City of Lynchburg. In south central Virginia, Bedford. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 820 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Beaverpond Branch, Dreaming Creek, Chestnut Branch, Caldwells Creek, Blackwater Creek, Buck Branch, Buttom Creek, Elk Creek, Bent Creek, Burton Creek, Falling River, Blackfoot Creek and Carters Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lynchburg... Appomattox... Concord... Rustburg... Forest... Bocock... Madison Heights... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
